subsections.heading: Required Access
subsections.content:
To load sample data, you must have Project Owner access to the project.
Users with Organization Owner access must add themselves to the
project as a Project Owner .

subsections.heading: Prerequisites
subsections.content:
To utilize the sample data provided by Atlas , you must create
an Atlas cluster to load data into. To learn more,
see Cluster Types .

subsections.heading: Load Sample Data into Your Cluster
subsections.content: You can load sample data into your Atlas cluster from the Atlas CLI or the Atlas UI . To load sample data into your local deployment, see Load Sample Data into Your Local Deployment .

sections.heading: Tip
sections.content:
You can use the local deployment steps to load data
into a MongoDB Community or Enterprise cluster.

subsections.heading: Load Sample Data into Your Local Deployment
subsections.content:
To load sample data into your local deployment:
Run the following command in your terminal to download the sample data:
Run the following command to load the data into your deployment,
replacing <port-number> with the port where you're hosting the
deployment:

sections.heading: Available Sample Datasets
sections.content:
The following table shows the sample datasets available for Atlas clusters. Click a sample dataset to learn more about it.
For instructions on loading this sample data into your Atlas cluster, see Load Sample Data .
Sample AirBnB Listings Dataset
Contains details on AirBnB listings.
Sample Analytics Dataset
Contains training data for a mock financial services
application.
Sample Geospatial Dataset
Contains shipwreck data.
Sample Guides Dataset
Contains planet data.
Sample Mflix Dataset
Contains movie data. Includes vector embeddings .
Sample Restaurants Dataset
Contains restaurant data.
Sample Supply Store Dataset
Contains data from a mock office supply store.
Sample Training Dataset
Contains MongoDB training services dataset.
Sample Weather Dataset
Contains detailed weather reports.

sections.heading: Sample Data Namespaces
sections.content:
When you load the sample data, Atlas creates the following
namespaces on your cluster:

sections.heading: Warning
sections.content:
If any of these namespaces already exist on your
cluster when you attempt to load the sample data,
the operation will fail and no sample data will be loaded into your
cluster.

listingsAndReviews

subsections.heading: Atlas Tutorials
subsections.content:
The Get Started with Atlas tutorial walks through setting up
an Atlas cluster and populating that cluster with sample
data.

subsections.heading: MongoDB Charts Tutorials
subsections.content:
The following MongoDB Charts tutorials guide you through
visualizing sample data provided by Atlas :

sections.heading: Tip
sections.content:
To visualize data in MongoDB Charts from the Atlas UI, click Visualize Your Data when viewing a specific database
or collection. Charts loads the data source and you can
start building a chart in the Charts view. For detailed
steps, see Build Charts .
